get.description:
A simple health check endpoint that pings the database.
Extend with any other dependency checks as needed.

schema.title: Response Health Check V1 Health Get

post.description:
Registers a run_id for server-side event monitoring.
Requires a valid API key.

get.description:
Client connects here using Server-Sent Events (SSE) to receive
real-time events for a specific run_id. Requires a valid API key.

post.description: Handles streaming completion requests using the appropriate inference provider.

200.description: A stream of JSON-formatted completions chunks

post.description:
Create a thread. If `participant_ids` are absent in the payload,
we infer the caller from the authenticated API‑key.

schema.title: Response List User Threads V1 Threads User  User Id  Get

post.description: Creates a new user. Requires **Admin** authentication via API Key.

get.description: Retrieves details for a specific user.

put.description: Updates details for a specific user.

delete.description: Deletes a specific user. Requires **Admin** authentication.

get.description: List assistants for the caller (derived from API-key).

schema.title: Response List Assistants V1 Assistants Get

put.description: Update any mutable assistant fields – including `tool_resources`.

schema.title: Response Get Formatted Messages V1 Threads  Thread Id  Formatted Messages Get
Response Get Actions By Status V1 Runs  Run Id  Actions Status Get

get.description:
Retrieve all pending actions with their function arguments, tool names,
and run details. Filter by run_id.

schema.title: Response Get Pending Actions V1 Actions Pending  Run Id  Get

get.summary: Generate a temporary signed URL (no API key required)

schema.title: Response Generate Signed Url V1 Files  File Id  Signed Url Get
Response Get File As Base64 V1 Files  File Id  Base64 Get

post.description:
Creates a new vector-store.  

- **Regular callers** → the store is assigned to *their* user-id.  
- **Admins** → may pass the optional `owner_id` query-param to create the store for a different user.

parameters.name: owner_id

schema.description: Target user-id (admin-only).  If omitted, the store is created for the caller.
schema.title: Owner Id

parameters.description: Target user-id (admin-only).  If omitted, the store is created for the caller.

schema.title: Response List My Vector Stores V1 Vector Stores Get

get.summary: (admin) list vector-stores for a given user_id

schema.title: Response List Vector Stores By User V1 Vector Stores Admin By User Get
Response List Files V1 Vector Stores  Vector Store Id  Files Get
Response Attach Store V1 Assistants  Assistant Id  Vector Stores  Vector Store Id  Attach Post
Response Detach Store V1 Assistants  Assistant Id  Vector Stores  Vector Store Id  Detach Delete
Response List Assistant Stores V1 Assistants  Assistant Id  Vector Stores Get

get.summary: Get Vector Store by Collection Name
get.description: Retrieves vector-store metadata using its unique collection name.

post.description: Generates a new API key for the specified user. The plain key is returned only once.

get.description: Retrieves a list of API keys for the specified user.
Retrieves details for a specific API key using its prefix.

delete.description: Revokes (deactivates) a specific API key using its prefix.

post.summary: Admin: Create API Key for User
post.description: Allows an authenticated administrator to create a new API key for any specified user.

key_name.title: Key Name
key_name.description: An optional user-friendly name for the key (e.g., 'My Production Key').

expires_in_days.title: Expires In Days
expires_in_days.description: Optional number of days from now until the key automatically expires. Minimum value is 1.

ApiKeyCreateRequest.title: ApiKeyCreateRequest
ApiKeyCreateRequest.description: Schema for the request body when creating a new API key.

plain_key.title: Plain Key
plain_key.description: The generated API key. This is the ONLY time this key will be shown. Store it securely immediately.

details.description: The details of the API key record that was created in the database.

ApiKeyCreateResponse.title: ApiKeyCreateResponse
ApiKeyCreateResponse.description:
Schema for the response after successfully creating an API key.
Crucially includes the plain text key which should be stored securely by the client.

prefix.title: Prefix
prefix.description: The non-secret unique prefix of the key (e.g., 'ea_abc123'). Used for identification.

key_name.title: Key Name
key_name.description: The user-friendly name assigned to the key, if any.

user_id.title: User Id
user_id.description: The ID of the user who owns this key.

created_at.title: Created At
created_at.description: The timestamp (UTC) when the key was created.

expires_at.title: Expires At
expires_at.description: The timestamp (UTC) when the key will expire, if an expiration was set.

last_used_at.title: Last Used At
last_used_at.description: The timestamp (UTC) when the key was last successfully used for authentication (if tracked).

is_active.title: Is Active
is_active.description: Indicates if the key is currently active and usable for authentication.

ApiKeyDetails.title: ApiKeyDetails
ApiKeyDetails.description:
Schema representing the public details of an API key.
This schema does *not* include the secret key itself.
It's designed to be created from the ApiKey ORM model.

keys.title: Keys
keys.description: A list containing the details of the API keys associated with the user.

ApiKeyListResponse.title: ApiKeyListResponse
ApiKeyListResponse.description:
Schema for the response when listing API keys for a user.
Contains a list of key details.

deleted.title: Deleted
deleted.description: True if the file was deleted successfully

bytes.title: Bytes
bytes.description: Size of the file in bytes

created_at.title: Created At
created_at.description: ISO‑8601 timestamp when the file was created (datetime or ISO string accepted)

filename.title: Filename
filename.description: Original filename supplied by the user

example.content: Hello, this is a test message.

user_id.title: User Id
user_id.description: Filled in by the server from the caller’s API-key. Clients MAY omit or set to None.

participant_ids.title: Participant Ids
participant_ids.description: List of participant IDs. Omit to default to the authenticated user.

tool_resources.title: Tool Resources
tool_resources.description: Updated tool resources for the thread

UserBase.title: UserBase
UserBase.description: Base schema, potentially used for embedding user info minimally.

provider_user_id.title: Provider User Id
provider_user_id.description: User ID from the OAuth provider.

UserCreate.title: UserCreate
UserCreate.description: Schema for creating a new user (e.g., manual or OAuth).

UserRead.title: UserRead
UserRead.description: Schema for reading user details from the API.

shared_id.title: Shared Id
shared_id.description: Pre-generated unique ID (also used as collection name).

VectorStoreCreateWithSharedId.title: VectorStoreCreateWithSharedId
VectorStoreCreateWithSharedId.description:
Same payload as `VectorStoreCreate`, but the client pre-generates the
shared/collection ID so Qdrant can be provisioned first.

processed_at.title: Processed At
processed_at.description: Unix timestamp of last processing change

status.description: New status for the file record

id.title: Id
id.description: Unique identifier for the vector store

VectorStoreRead.title: VectorStoreRead
VectorStoreRead.description: Metadata returned from the API for an existing vector-store.
